titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the John Elari Photographic Slide Collection
1965-1999
PR 285
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Marybeth Kavanagh

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-04-07T10:19-0400

did.abstract: This collection consists of 1,000 photographic slides taken by New York City resident John Elari (1943- ). The collection spans the period from 1965-1999 and is composed of images of New York City and its inhabitants.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as: John Elari Photographic Slide Collection, PR 285, Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Elari was born in Brooklyn, NY on 6 April 1943. He developed an interest in photography while spending the summer of 1964 traveling in Europe. Elari completed a degree in interior design at the Paier School of Art in Hamden, CT in 1965, and then moved back to New York City. He worked as an interior designer, and then as a florist from 1974-2000, all the while honing his photography skills. Elari's photographs document the cityscape and street life of New York City from 1965-1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The John Elari Photographic Slide Collection consists of 1,000 color slides of New York City, mainly Manhattan, taken between 1965 and 1999. The collection is arranged by the subject of the photograph, as originally identified and organized by the photographer. These subjects include Bridges, Buildings, Events, Monuments and Statues, Neighborhoods, Night Scenes, Parks and Gardens, People, Skylines and Cityscapes, and Transportation. Labels on the slide sheets, as well as any titles and dates on the slides, were provided by the photographer.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: Processed by archivist Marybeth Kavanagh in March 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Images of NYC bridges, including the Brooklyn Bridge and Williamsburg Bridge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Photos of Broadway theaters, Chrysler Building, Empire State Building, Pan Am Building, Rockefeller Center, Trump Tower, and the World Trade Center (Twin Towers).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Images of the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade, the Bicentennial Celebration, Christmas displays, and the Easter parade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: These are the images that the photographer, John Elari, considered "the best of the lot." He labeled these "the exceptionals." The subject matter of the slides is consistent with the other slide sheets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Images of the Statue of Liberty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Views of Chinatown, Times Square, and the Financial District.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Photographs that capture New York City after dark, including views of Lincoln Center, Park Ave, and the Upper West Side.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Images of the Brooklyn Botanic Gardens, Central Park, Hudson River Park. Also includes images of people playing volleyball, and snow scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of people in parks, street performers, musicians, street vendors, chess players, children, elderly people, and homeless people.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Views of Manhattan from different vantage points. Includes images of cars and street traffic, digital neon signs, and street views.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Images of buses, subway stations and trains, and the Staten Island Ferry.
